00074 class CTwnDsmAppsImpl
00075 {
00076   public:
00077 
00081     CTwnDsmAppsImpl()
00082     {
00083     memset(&pod,0,sizeof(pod));
00084     }
00085 
00095   int scanDSDir(char *_szAbsPath,
00096               TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId);
00097 
00103     char *StringFromCC(const TW_UINT16 cc);
00104 
00113   TW_INT16 LoadDS(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00114           char *_pPath,
00115           TW_UINT32 _DsId,
00116           bool _boolKeepOpen);
00117 
00123   void AppSetConditionCode(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00124                TW_UINT16 conditioncode);
00125 
00126   public:
00127     // If you add a class in future, declare it here and not in
00128   // the pod, or the memset in the constructor will ruin your
00129   // day...
00130 
00135     struct _pod
00136   {
00137       APP_INFO    m_AppInfo[MAX_NUM_APPS];  
00138     TW_UINT16   m_conditioncode;      
00139   } pod;
00140 };

00152     kLOG((kLOGERR,"new of CTwnDsmAppsImpl failed..."));
00153   }

00166   m_ptwndsmappsimpl = 0;

00171 
00182 TW_UINT16 CTwnDsmApps::AddApp(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00183                 TW_MEMREF _MemRef)
00184 {
00185   int ii;
00186 
00187   // Validate...
00188   if (_pAppId->ProductName[0] == 0)
00189   {
00190     AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_BADVALUE);
00191     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00192   }
00193 
00194   // Check to see if this app has already been opened, and
00195   // if so, treat it as a sequence error, because this app
00196   // is already open...
00197   for (ii = 1; ii < MAX_NUM_APPS; ii++)
00198   {
00199   if (!strncmp(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].identity.ProductName,_pAppId->ProductName,sizeof(TW_STR32)))
00200     {
00201       kLOG((kLOGERR,"A successful MSG_OPENDSM was already done for %s...",_pAppId->ProductName));
00202     AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_SEQERROR);
00203     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00204     }
00205   }
00206 
00207   //Go through the list and find an empty location
00208   // Already tested that there is enough room to fit
00209   for (ii=1; ii < MAX_NUM_APPS; ii++)
00210   {
00211   if (!m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].identity.Id)
00212     {
00213       // The application ID is always +1 greater then the array index it resides in.
00214       // We just let the 0-index stay empty...
00215       _pAppId->Id = ii;
00216       m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].identity = *_pAppId;
00217     m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].hwnd   = (HWND)(_MemRef?*(HWND*)_MemRef:0);
00218       m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].pDSList  = (DS_LIST*)calloc(sizeof(DS_LIST)+1,1);
00219     if (!m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].pDSList)
00220     {
00221         kLOG((kLOGERR,"calloc failed for %s...",_pAppId->ProductName));
00222       AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_LOWMEMORY);
00223       return TWRC_FAILURE;
00224     }
00225     break;
00226     }
00227   }
00228 
00229   // We've run out of room...
00230   if (ii >= MAX_NUM_APPS)
00231   {
00232     kLOG((kLOGERR,"We've hit the maximum number of connections..."));
00233   AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_MAXCONNECTIONS);
00234   return TWRC_FAILURE;
00235   }
00236 
00237   // Recursively navigate the TWAIN datasource dir looking for data sources.
00238   if (m_ptwndsmappsimpl->scanDSDir(kTWAIN_DS_DIR,_pAppId) == EXIT_FAILURE)
00239   {
00240     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Something bad happened while we were looking for drivers..."));
00241   AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
00242     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00243   }
00244 
00245   // Move DSM to state 3 for this app...
00246   m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[ii].CurrentState = dsmState_Open;
00247 
00248   // All done...
00249   return TWRC_SUCCESS;
00250 }
00251 
00252 
00253 
00264 TW_UINT16 CTwnDsmApps::RemoveApp(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00265 {
00266   // Validate...
00267   if (   (_pAppId->Id < 1)
00268     || (_pAppId->Id >= MAX_NUM_APPS))
00269   {
00270     kLOG((kLOGERR,"_id is out of range...%d",_pAppId->Id));
00271     AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_BADVALUE);
00272     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00273   }
00274 
00275   // To close the DSM we must be open.  I don't really like this
00276   // piece of code.  To my way of thinking a close should always
00277   // succeed, even if there are mice in the DVD drive and the
00278   // monitor is on fire.  The notion of a failure message during
00279   // a close is annoying.  But there might be a good reason for
00280   // this I'm not aware of...
00281   if (dsmState_Open != m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].CurrentState)
00282   {
00283     AppSetConditionCode(0,TWCC_SEQERROR);
00284     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00285   }
00286 
00287   // Get rid of our list of drivers...
00288   if (m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList)
00289   {
00290     free(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList);
00291     m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList = NULL;
00292   }
00293 
00294   // Scrub this application's structure...
00295   memset(&m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].identity,
00296        0,
00297      sizeof(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].identity));
00298 
00299   // Switch application's DSM state to state 2...
00300   m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].CurrentState = dsmState_Loaded;
00301 
00302   // All done...
00303   return TWRC_SUCCESS;
00304 }
00305

00307 
00312 TW_BOOL CTwnDsmApps::AppValidateId(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00313 {
00314   if (!_pAppId)
00315   {
00316     kLOG((kLOGERR,"_pAppId is null..."));
00317     return false;
00318   }
00319   else if (_pAppId->Id >= MAX_NUM_APPS)
00320   {
00321     kLOG((kLOGERR,"invalid id...%d",_pAppId->Id));
00322     return false;
00323   }
00324   return true;
00325 }
00326

00328 
00333 TW_IDENTITY *CTwnDsmApps::AppGetIdentity(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00334 {
00335   if (AppValidateId(_pAppId))
00336   {
00337     return &m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].identity;
00338   }
00339   kLOG((kLOGERR,"bad _pAppId..."));
00340   return NULL;
00341 }

00343 
00344 
00354 TW_UINT16 CTwnDsmApps::AppGetConditionCode(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00355 {
00356   TW_UINT16 conditioncode;
00357 
00358   // Return the application specific value...
00359   if (AppValidateId(_pAppId))
00360   {
00361     conditioncode = m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_conditioncode;
00362     m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_conditioncode = TWRC_SUCCESS;
00363   return conditioncode;
00364   }
00365   // Uh-oh, we have no app, so return the global value...
00366   else
00367   {
00368     conditioncode = m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].ConditionCode;
00369     m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].ConditionCode = TWRC_SUCCESS;
00370   return conditioncode;
00371   }
00372 }

00375 
00381 void CTwnDsmApps::AppSetConditionCode(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00382                     TW_UINT16   _ConditionCode)
00383 {
00384   return m_ptwndsmappsimpl->AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,_ConditionCode);
00385 }

00387 
00388 
00394 void CTwnDsmAppsImpl::AppSetConditionCode(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00395                         TW_UINT16   _ConditionCode)
00396 {
00397   // We have no application identity to work with...
00398   if (   (0 == _pAppId)
00399     || (0 == _pAppId->Id)
00400     || (0 == pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].identity.Id))
00401   {
00402     pod.m_conditioncode = _ConditionCode;
00403   }
00404 
00405   // This is where we normally expect to be...
00406   else
00407   {
00408   pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].ConditionCode = _ConditionCode;
00409   }
00410 
00411   // Make a note of this in the log...
00412   if (_ConditionCode != TWCC_SUCCESS)
00413   {
00414     kLOG((kLOGINFO,"Condition Code: %s",StringFromCC(_ConditionCode)));
00415   }
00416 
00417   // All done...
00418   return;
00419 }

00422 
00430 DSM_State CTwnDsmApps::AppGetState(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00431 {
00432   // Return the application specific state...
00433   if (AppValidateId(_pAppId))
00434   {
00435     return m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].CurrentState;
00436   }
00437   // Otherwise we must be in state 2.  Good luck ever getting state 1
00438   // out of the DSM...  :)
00439   else
00440   {
00441     return dsmState_Loaded;
00442   }
00443 }

00446 
00453 TW_UINT32 CTwnDsmApps::AppGetNumDs(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00454 {
00455   // Return the number of drivers we found...
00456   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
00457     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList)
00458   {
00459     return m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->NumFiles;
00460   }
00461   // Not a lot of choice, the value has to be zero...
00462   else
00463   {
00464     return 0;
00465   }
00466 }

00469 
00476 TW_IDENTITY *CTwnDsmApps::DsGetIdentity(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00477                     TW_UINT32   _DsId)
00478 {
00479   // Return a pointer to the driver's identity...
00480   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
00481     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList
00482     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS))
00483   {
00484     return &m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].Identity;
00485   }
00486   // Something is toasted, so return NULL...
00487   else
00488   {
00489     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Returning NULL from DsGetIdentity..."));
00490     return NULL;
00491   }
00492 }

00509   }
00510   // Something is toasted, so return NULL...
00511   else
00512   {
00513     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Returning NULL from DsGetEntryProc..."));
00514     return NULL;

00534   }

00552                     TW_UINT32   _DsId)

00557     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS))
00558   {
00559     return &m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].twcallback;
00560   }
00561   // Something is toasted, so return NULL...
00562   else
00563   {
00564     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Returning NULL from DsCallbackGet..."));
00565     return NULL;
00566   }
00567 }

00570 
00576 TW_BOOL CTwnDsmApps::DsCallbackIsWaiting(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00577                      TW_UINT32   _DsId)
00578 {
00579   // Check the waiting flag...
00580   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
00581     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList
00582     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS))
00583   {
00584     return    m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].bCallbackPending
00585          && m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].twcallback.CallBackProc;
00586   }
00587   // Something is toasted, so return FALSE...
00588   else
00589   {
00590     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Returning FALSE from DsCallbackIsWaiting..."));
00591     return FALSE;
00592   }
00593 }

00596 
00601 void CTwnDsmApps::DsCallbackSetWaiting(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00602                        TW_UINT32   _DsId,
00603                        TW_BOOL     _Waiting)
00604 {
00605   // Set the waiting flag...
00606   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
00607     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList
00608     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS))
00609   {
00610     m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].bCallbackPending = _Waiting;
00611   }
00612   // Something is toasted, so whine about it...
00613   else
00614   {
00615     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Unable to properly handle DsCallbackSetWaiting..."));
00616   }
00617 }

00620 
00624 char *CTwnDsmAppsImpl::StringFromCC(const TW_UINT16 cc)
00625 {
00626   switch(cc)
00627   {
00628     case TWCC_SUCCESS:
00629       return "TWRC_SUCCESS";
00630       break;
00631 
00632     case TWCC_BUMMER:
00633       return "Failure due to unknown causes";
00634       break;
00635 
00636     case TWCC_LOWMEMORY:
00637       return "Not enough memory to perform operation";
00638       break;
00639 
00640     case TWCC_NODS:
00641       return "No Data Source";
00642       break;
00643 
00644     case TWCC_MAXCONNECTIONS:
00645       return "DS is connected to max possible applications";
00646       break;
00647 
00648     case TWCC_OPERATIONERROR:
00649       return "DS or DSM reported error, application shouldn't";
00650       break;
00651 
00652     case TWCC_BADCAP:
00653       return "Unknown capability";
00654       break;
00655 
00656     case TWCC_BADPROTOCOL:
00657       return "Unrecognized MSG DG DAT combination";
00658       break;
00659 
00660     case TWCC_BADVALUE:
00661       return "Data parameter out of range";
00662       break;
00663 
00664     case TWCC_SEQERROR:
00665       return "DG DAT MSG out of expected sequence";
00666       break;
00667 
00668     case TWCC_BADDEST:
00669       return "Unknown destination Application/Source in DSM_Entry";
00670       break;
00671 
00672     case TWCC_CAPUNSUPPORTED:
00673       return "Capability not supported by source";
00674       break;
00675 
00676     case TWCC_CAPBADOPERATION:
00677       return "Operation not supported by capability";
00678       break;
00679 
00680     case TWCC_CAPSEQERROR:
00681       return "Capability has dependancy on other capability";
00682       break;
00683 
00684     case TWCC_DENIED:
00685       return "File System operation is denied (file is protected)";
00686       break;
00687 
00688     case TWCC_FILEEXISTS:
00689       return "Operation failed because file already exists.";
00690       break;
00691 
00692     case TWCC_FILENOTFOUND:
00693       return "File not found";
00694       break;
00695 
00696     case TWCC_NOTEMPTY:
00697       return "Operation failed because directory is not empty";
00698       break;
00699 
00700     case TWCC_PAPERJAM:
00701       return "The feeder is jammed";
00702       break;
00703 
00704     case TWCC_PAPERDOUBLEFEED:
00705       return "The feeder detected multiple pages";
00706       break;
00707 
00708     case TWCC_FILEWRITEERROR:
00709       return "Error writing the file (meant for things like disk full conditions)";
00710       break;
00711 
00712     case TWCC_CHECKDEVICEONLINE:
00713       return "The device went offline prior to or during this operation";
00714       break;
00715   }
00716 
00717   static TW_STR32 hex;
00718   SSNPRINTF(hex, NCHARS(hex), 32, "TWCC 0x%04x", cc);
00719 
00720   return hex;
00721 }
00722 
00723 
00724 
00734 int CTwnDsmAppsImpl::scanDSDir(char      *_szAbsPath,
00735                      TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
00736 {
00737   // Validate...
00738   if (   !_szAbsPath
00739     || !_pAppId)
00740   {
00741     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00742   }
00743 
00744   //
00745   // Take care of VC++...
00746   //
00747   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00748     WIN32_FIND_DATA   FileData;             // Data structure describes the file found
00749     HANDLE            hSearch;              // Search handle returned by FindFirstFile
00750     char              szABSFilename[FILENAME_MAX];
00751     BOOL              bFinished = FALSE;
00752     char              szPrevWorkDir[FILENAME_MAX];
00753 
00754     // Start searching for .ds files in the root directory.
00755     SSTRCPY(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), _szAbsPath);
00756     SSTRCAT(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), "\\*.ds");
00757     hSearch = FindFirstFile(szABSFilename,&FileData);
00758 
00759     // If we find something, squirrel it away and anything else we find...
00760     if (hSearch != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00761     {
00762       /* Save the current working directory: */
00763       char *szResult = _getcwd( szPrevWorkDir, sizeof(szPrevWorkDir) );
00764       if (szResult == (char*)NULL)
00765       {
00766         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00767       }
00768       int iResult = _chdir(_szAbsPath);
00769       if (iResult != 0)
00770       {
00771         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00772       }
00773     
00774       while (!bFinished)
00775       {
00776         if (SSNPRINTF(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), FILENAME_MAX, "%s\\%s", _szAbsPath, FileData.cFileName) > 0)
00777         {
00778           if (TWRC_SUCCESS == LoadDS(_pAppId,
00779                    szABSFilename,
00780                    pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->NumFiles+1,
00781                    false))
00782           {
00783             pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->NumFiles++;
00784           }
00785         }
00786       
00787         if (!FindNextFile(hSearch, &FileData))
00788         {
00789           bFinished = TRUE;
00790         }
00791       }
00792     
00793       if (!FindClose (hSearch))
00794       {
00795         (void)_chdir( szPrevWorkDir );
00796         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00797       }
00798     }
00799 
00800     // Start searching sub directories.
00801     SSTRCPY(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), _szAbsPath);
00802     SSTRCAT(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), "\\*.*");
00803     hSearch = FindFirstFile(szABSFilename, &FileData);
00804     bFinished = FALSE;
00805     if (hSearch == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00806     {
00807       (void)_chdir( szPrevWorkDir );
00808       return EXIT_FAILURE;
00809     }
00810     while (!bFinished)
00811     {
00812       if (   (strcmp(".", FileData.cFileName) != 0)
00813           && (strcmp("..", FileData.cFileName) != 0)
00814           && (FileData.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY) )
00815       {
00816         if (SSNPRINTF(szABSFilename, NCHARS(szABSFilename), FILENAME_MAX, "%s\\%s", _szAbsPath, FileData.cFileName) > 0)
00817         {
00818           scanDSDir(szABSFilename,_pAppId);
00819         }
00820       }
00821   
00822       if (!FindNextFile(hSearch, &FileData))
00823       {
00824         bFinished = TRUE;
00825       }
00826     }
00827   
00828     (void)_chdir( szPrevWorkDir );
00829 
00830     if (!FindClose (hSearch))
00831     {
00832       return EXIT_FAILURE;
00833     }
00834 
00835     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00836 
00837   
00838   
00839   //
00840   // Take care of g++...
00841   //
00842   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
00843     char szABSFilename[FILENAME_MAX];
00844 
00845     DIR *pdir;
00846     if ((pdir=opendir(_szAbsPath)) == 0)
00847     {
00848       perror("opendir");
00849       return EXIT_FAILURE;
00850     }
00851 
00852     struct dirent *pfile; 
00853     while(errno=0, ((pfile=readdir(pdir)) != 0))
00854     { 
00855       if ( (strcmp(".", pfile->d_name) == 0)
00856        || (strcmp("..", pfile->d_name) == 0) )
00857       {
00858         continue;
00859       }
00860 
00861       if (SNPRINTF(szABSFilename,FILENAME_MAX,"%s/%s",_szAbsPath,pfile->d_name) < 0)
00862       {
00863         continue;
00864       }
00865 
00866       struct stat st;
00867       if (lstat(szABSFilename, &st) < 0)
00868       {
00869         perror("lstat");
00870         continue;
00871       }
00872 
00873       if (S_ISDIR(st.st_mode))
00874       {
00875         scanDSDir(szABSFilename,_pAppId);
00876       }
00877       else if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode) && (0 != strstr(pfile->d_name, ".ds")))
00878       {
00879         if (TWRC_SUCCESS == LoadDS(_pAppId,
00880                    szABSFilename,
00881                    pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->NumFiles+1,
00882                    false))
00883         {
00884           pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->NumFiles++;
00885         }
00886       }
00887     } 
00888   
00889     if (0 != errno)
00890     {
00891       perror("readdir");
00892     }
00893 
00894     closedir(pdir); 
00895     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00896 
00897 
00898 
00899   //
00900   // meh!
00901   //
00902   #else
00903     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
00904   #endif
00905 }
00906 
00907 
00908 
00913 TW_INT16 CTwnDsmApps::LoadDS(TW_IDENTITY  *_pAppId,
00914                              TW_UINT32    _DsId)
00915 {
00916   // Load the specified driver...
00917   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
00918     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList
00919     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS))
00920   {
00921     return m_ptwndsmappsimpl->LoadDS(_pAppId,
00922                      m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].szPath,
00923                      _DsId,
00924                      true);
00925   }
00926   // Something is toasted, so return LoadDS...
00927   else
00928   {
00929     kLOG((kLOGERR,"Returning TWRC_FAILURE from DsCallbackIsWaiting..."));
00930     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00931   }
00932 }
00933 
00934 
00935 
00943 TW_INT16 CTwnDsmAppsImpl::LoadDS(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId,
00944                  char     *_pPath,
00945                  TW_UINT32    _DsId,
00946                  bool     _boolKeepOpen)
00947 {
00948   TW_INT16 result = TWRC_SUCCESS;
00949   DS_INFO  *pDSInfo;
00950 
00951   // Validate...
00952   if (   (0 == _pPath)
00953       || (_DsId >= MAX_NUM_DS))
00954   {
00955     // bad path or too many DS's already open
00956     AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
00957     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00958   }
00959 
00960   // Initialize stuff...
00961   pDSInfo = &pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId];
00962 
00963   // Try to load the driver...
00964   pDSInfo->pHandle = LOADLIBRARY(_pPath);
00965   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00966     if (0 == pDSInfo->pHandle)
00967     {
00968       kLOG((kLOGERR,"Could not load library: %s",_pPath));
00969       AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
00970     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00971   }
00972   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
00973     if (0 == pDSInfo->pHandle)
00974     {
00975       // This is a bit skanky, and not the sort of thing I really want
00976     // a user to have to see, but more info is better than less, so
00977     // hopefully someone will be able to sort out what the cryptic
00978     // message means and we can FAQ it...
00979       fprintf(stderr,">>> error loading <%s>\r\n",_pPath);
00980       fprintf(stderr,">>> %s\r\n",dlerror());
00981       fprintf(stderr,">>> please contact your scanner or driver vendor for more\r\n");
00982     fprintf(stderr,">>> help, if that doesn't help then check out the FAQ at\r\n");
00983     fprintf(stderr,">>> http://www.twain.org\r\n");
00984       kLOG((kLOGERR,"Could not load library: %s",_pPath));
00985     kLOG((kLOGERR,dlerror()));
00986       AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
00987     return TWRC_FAILURE;
00988   }
00989   #else
00990     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
00991   #endif
00992 
00993   // Try to get the entry point...
00994   pDSInfo->DS_Entry = (DSENTRYPROC)LOADFUNCTION(pDSInfo->pHandle,"DS_Entry");
00995   if (pDSInfo->DS_Entry == 0)
00996   {
00997   kLOG((kLOGERR,"Could not find DSM_Entry function in DS: %s",_pPath));
00998     #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
00999       UNLOADLIBRARY(pDSInfo->pHandle);
01000       pDSInfo->pHandle = NULL;
01001       AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
01002       return TWRC_FAILURE; 
01003     #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
01004       kLOG((kLOGERR,"dlsym: %s",dlerror()));
01005       AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
01006       return TWRC_FAILURE;
01007     #else
01008       #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
01009     #endif
01010   }
01011 
01012   // Report success and squirrel away the index...
01013   kLOG((kLOGINFO,"Loaded library: %s",_pPath));
01014   pDSInfo->Identity.Id = _DsId;
01015 
01016   // Get the source to fill in the identity structure
01017   // This operation should never fail on any DS
01018   // We need the NULL to be backwards compatible with the
01019   // older DSM.  This is the only way a driver can tell if
01020   // it's being talked to directly by the DSM instead of
01021   // by the application (with the DSM as a passthru)...
01022   result = pDSInfo->DS_Entry(NULL,DG_CONTROL,DAT_IDENTITY,MSG_GET,(TW_MEMREF)&pDSInfo->Identity);
01023   if (result != TWRC_SUCCESS)
01024   {
01025     UNLOADLIBRARY(pDSInfo->pHandle);
01026     pDSInfo->pHandle = NULL;
01027     pDSInfo->DS_Entry = NULL;
01028     AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
01029     return TWRC_FAILURE;
01030   }
01031 
01032   // Compare the supported groups.  Note that the & is correct
01033   // because we are comparing bits...
01034   if (  !((_pAppId->SupportedGroups & 0x00fffffe)    // app supports
01035     &   (pDSInfo->Identity.SupportedGroups & 0x00fffffe))) // source supports
01036   {
01037     UNLOADLIBRARY(pDSInfo->pHandle);
01038     pDSInfo->pHandle = NULL;
01039     pDSInfo->DS_Entry = NULL;
01040     AppSetConditionCode(_pAppId,TWCC_OPERATIONERROR);
01041     return TWRC_FAILURE;
01042   }
01043 
01044   // The DS should not modify the Id even though the spec states
01045   // that the id will not be assigned until DSM sends MSG_OPENDS to DS
01046   pDSInfo->Identity.Id = _DsId;
01047   SSTRNCPY(pDSInfo->szPath, NCHARS(pDSInfo->szPath),_pPath,FILENAME_MAX);
01048 
01049   // We have to clear the DLL because of a limitation that prevents
01050   // loading identically named modules.
01051   if (_boolKeepOpen == false)
01052   {
01053     UNLOADLIBRARY(pDSInfo->pHandle);
01054     pDSInfo->pHandle = NULL;
01055     pDSInfo->DS_Entry = NULL;
01056   }
01057 
01058   return result;
01059 }
01060 
01061 
01062 
01071 void CTwnDsmApps::UnloadDS(TW_IDENTITY  *_pAppId,
01072                            TW_UINT32  _DsId)
01073 {
01074   // Unload the specified driver...
01075   if (    AppValidateId(_pAppId)
01076     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList
01077     &&  (_DsId < MAX_NUM_DS)
01078     &&  m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].pHandle)
01079   {
01080     // Unload the library...
01081     UNLOADLIBRARY(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId].pHandle);
01082   // Scrub the structure...
01083     memset(&m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId],
01084        0,
01085        sizeof(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].pDSList->DSInfo[_DsId]));
01086   }
01087 }
01088 
01089 
01090 
01097 void CTwnDsmApps::AppWakeup(TW_IDENTITY *_pAppId)
01098 {
01099   #if (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_VISUALCPP)
01100   if (   AppValidateId(_pAppId)
01101     && m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].hwnd)
01102   {
01103       // Force the parent to process a message.  WM_NULL is
01104       // safe, because it's a no-op...
01105     ::PostMessage(m_ptwndsmappsimpl->pod.m_AppInfo[_pAppId->Id].hwnd,WM_NULL,(WPARAM)0,(LPARAM)0);
01106   }
01107   #elif (TWNDSM_CMP == TWNDSM_CMP_GNUGPP)
01108   kLOG((kLOGERR,"We shouldn't be here in AppWakeup..."));
01109     // We don't support this path on this platform, use
01110   // callbacks instead...
01111   #else
01112     #error Sorry, we don't recognize this system...
01113   #endif
01114 }
